segments.text: I notice the woman drying the plate, completely focused on her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even seem to notice the water spilling all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are sneaking cookies right behind her back, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious she is to everything happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing right there, waiting for her share, and it’s almost sweet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a snapshot of a moment that’s about to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and she’s still drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little sad for her, missing all of this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is one of those moments that makes me think about how much we miss in life.
segments.speaker: PAR
